ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: To prove their personal competence, economic operators are to submit the following documents:
— statement by the economic operator that it has not been imposed a legally valid court decision for participation in criminal organization, corruption, fraud or money laundering in the last 5 years,
— certificate by a competent body that a bankruptcy procedure has not been initiated,
— certificate by a competent body that a liquidation procedure has not been initiated,
— certificate by a competent body from the country where that economic operator is registered for paid taxes, contributions and other public fees,

— certificate by the Register of sentences for committed crimes of legal entities that a secondary sentence prohibition on participation on public procurement advertisements, award of contracts for public procurements and contracts for public-private partnership, has not been imposed,
— certificate by the Register of Sentences for committed crimes of legal entities that a secondary sentence temporary or permanent prohibition on performing a certain activity, has not been imposed,

— certificate that a misdemeanor sanction resulting in prohibition for practicing profession, performing activity or duty, i.e. temporary prohibition for performing a particular activity has not been imposed by a legally valid court decision.
To prove the ability to perform professional activity, the economic operators should submit:
— Either a certificate for registered activity — CRA form, or proof of registered activity,
— Certificate for performing wholesale of drugs in compliance with the Law on medicinal products and medical devices.

T_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: Documents required as proof of the technical and professional competence of the economic operator:

— The economic operator must have obtained a valid license for selling finished drugs or temporary or permanent authorization for parallel imports, in compliance with the Law on medicinal products and medical devices for the offered goods.

T_CAPACITY_MIN_LEVEL.P: Minimum criterion for determining the technical and professional competence of the economic operator.
— A valid license for selling finished drugs or temporary or permanent authorization for parallel imports, in compliance with the Law on medicinal products and medical devices.
